conclusion: Liquid will flow out from A, B, and C, and the task is to predict which container (D or E) it will flow into after passing through baffles.
A, B, and C are the starting points of the liquid.
D and E are the containers that receive the liquid.
Stream A hits the purple baffle and changes its flow direction to the right.
Stream B drops straight down and hits the purple baffle.
Stream C drops straight down without meeting any obstacles.

premise: Stream A hits the purple baffle and changes its flow direction to the right.
conclusion: Stream A flows toward the orange container (D).

premise: Stream B drops straight down and hits the purple baffle.
conclusion: Stream B combines with the flow from A and flows toward the orange container (D).

premise: Stream C drops straight down without meeting any obstacles.
conclusion: Stream C flows toward the green container (E).

premise: Streams A and B flow toward container D, and stream C flows toward container E.
conclusion: Most of the liquids from A and B flow into container D, and few small mixture droplets reach container E; meanwhile, stream C flows entirely into container E.
